thread.title: Bengals inactive list: Sims sits and Gilberry active
thread.title_full: Bengals inactive list: Sims sits and Gilberry active

title: Bengals inactive list: Sims sits and Gilberry active
text:
Bengals inactive list: Sims sits and Gilberry active 
Updated: Sun, Oct 11 2015, 01:00 PM 
CINCINNATI (Richard Skinner) -- Bengals defensive lineman Wallace Gilberry, who missed practice Wednesday and Thursday and was limited on Friday due to a calf injury, is active for Sunday's game against the Seattle Seahawks, while defensive tackle Pat Sims is the lone surprise among the team's seven inactives. 
FOLLOW THE ACTION ALL GAME RIGHT HERE 
Gilberry was listed questionable on the official NFL injury report that was released on Friday. Safety George Iloka was also listed as questionable for the game due to an ankle injury that prevented him from playing last Sunday against Kansas City, but he practiced all three days last week and is also active for the Seattle game. 
Also made inactive for Sunday's game are: wide receivers Mario Alford and Greg Little; tight end C.J. Uzomah; cornerback Chris Lewis-Harris; rookie defensive tackle Marcus Hardison and defensive end Margus Hunt. 
It marks the fifth straight game that Alford, Little, Uzomah, Hardison and Hunt were made inactive. 
Sims being made inactive means that Brandon Thompson is active after not being active for the Kansas City game. 
Thompson was active for the Baltimore game and played 24 snaps with two tackles, including one for loss. 
SEAHAWKS INACTIVES: The Seahawks made the following players inactive for Sunday's game: cornerback Tye Smith; running back Marshawn Lynch; cornerback Marcus Burley; linebacker Kevin Pierre-Louis; offensive lineman Kristjan Sokoli; offensive lineman Alvin Bailey and defensive end Demarcus Dobbs. 
Thomas Rawls is expected to start at running back in place of Lynch, who was ruled out on Friday. 
Running back Rod Smith, an undrafted rookie free agent from Ohio State, was signed from the practice squad on Saturday due to the injury to Lynch and backup Fred Jackson, who is active, but was listed as questionable due to a high ankle sprain.
